title: I LOVE LISTS
description: I LOVE LISTS Organize with the “Chaos Method.” I want to participate in a cheddar taste test. People posing with their cars in the 1950s + 1960s. 80s & 90s nostalgia. Fall flowering perennials to add to your garden. Japanese handicraft videos are so relaxing. I’m excited Chef’s Table is coming back. Is the white casing on the salami mold? I’m already looking at Halloween costumes… How to find valuable books in thrift stores. This makes me want to go to Japan. This makes me want to cut paper. I want a hidden desk. Martha’s no cook meals. Hotels are ditching mini toiletries. Why American cheese melts better. Why are airplane windows round? Giving myself a mani with this nail polish this weekend. I am excited to start making Autumn Reset Button Salads! Weekend reading: The Artist’s Way This week on Keep Grief Weird we talk about the idea of “Only the Good Die Young.” We discuss parasocial relationships and how public grief can help us talk about GRIEF. We uploaded a video version of the podcast for paid subscribers. Thanks for your support! More of my August pages on The Handwriting Club The post I LOVE LISTS appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: Welcome to I LOVE LISTS. It's Friday and Tracy of Shutterbean.com shares her finds from the internet on a weekly list called I LOVE LISTS!
text: I LOVE LISTS  Organize with the “Chaos Method.” I want to participate in a cheddar taste test.  People posing with their cars in the 1950s + 1960s. 80s & 90s nostalgia. Fall flowering perennials to add to your garden. Japanese handicraft videos are so relaxing.  I’m excited Chef’s Table is coming back.  Is the white casing on the salami mold? I’m already looking at Halloween costumes… How to find valuable books in thrift stores. This makes me want to go to Japan.  This makes me want to cut paper. I want a hidden desk.  Martha’s no cook meals. Hotels are ditching mini toiletries.  Why American cheese melts better. Why are airplane windows round? Giving myself a mani with this nail polish this weekend. I am excited to start making Autumn Reset Button Salads!  Weekend reading: The Artist’s Way  This week on Keep Grief Weird we talk about the idea of “Only the Good Die Young.” We discuss parasocial relationships and how public grief can help us talk about GRIEF. We uploaded a video version of the podcast for paid subscribers. Thanks for your support!    More of my August pages on The Handwriting Club
html:
I LOVE LISTS 

  1. Organize with the “Chaos Method.”
  2. I want to participate in a cheddar taste test. 
  3. People posing with their cars in the 1950s + 1960s.
  4. 80s & 90s nostalgia.
  5. Fall flowering perennials to add to your garden.
  6. Japanese handicraft videos are so relaxing. 
  7. I’m excited Chef’s Table is coming back. 
  8. Is the white casing on the salami mold?
  9. I’m already looking at Halloween costumes…
  10. How to find valuable books in thrift stores.
  11. This makes me want to go to Japan. 
  12. This makes me want to cut paper.
  13. I want a hidden desk. 
  14. Martha’s no cook meals.
  15. Hotels are ditching mini toiletries. 
  16. Why American cheese melts better.
  17. Why are airplane windows round?
  18. Giving myself a mani with this nail polish this weekend.
  19. I am excited to start making Autumn Reset Button Salads! 
  20. Weekend reading: The Artist’s Way 

This week on Keep Grief Weird we talk about the idea of “Only the Good Die Young.” We discuss parasocial relationships and how public grief can help us talk about GRIEF. We uploaded a video version of the podcast for paid subscribers. Thanks for your support! 

 

More of my August pages on The Handwriting Club
